I play this game on console, rather than on PC. Bought it and played it near release time until my PC couldn't handle it, but my console could.
The game has constantly been introducing new content that doesn't really change anything up besides "Oh no? Now I have a different type of attack coming in my direction!" or "Now my attack isn't throwing an ax, but throwing vomit!"
Admittedly, I enjoy the variation, but I think there should definitely be some of that in more heavy doses.
Alongside this, the new content is repeatedly breaking the game to a point it is literally busted. If you add bugs 24/7 but don't fix them, they'll pile up.
In all honesty, I had to write this shitey review for one thing though,
The RANKING SYSTEM.
Since its release, it was pretty okay. No complaints but no praise for sure. Until they reworked it. It was fine really, but not very good. Oh, but guess what? They completely broke it now. As I've seen said in a lot of different forums, which is true, it really just shows that their original ranking system wasn't good to begin with. Now that they've increased the actual measure to rank up/not rank down, you can really see how terrible the measuring system for "how well you played" really is.
It isn't like this is some human mistake any natural person makes.
They've been told by countless people in PTB about the bugs. They've been told by countless people on forums about the issues with the ranking system.
They can clearly SEE THE BUGS when they play the game.
Why fix it though? Amirite?

Deleted my original review, as it was written back in 2016, and addressed a lot of issues that are not in the game anymore. However, the game is still a broken mess.

Developers clearly cater to survivors side, essentially, making them a power role in this 4x1 game, where the killer is just some poor lad to be bullied (while Killer gameplay, imo, takes much more skill and more variables to operate with and keep in mind while playing). Despite survivors being given clear and unfair advantages over the killer, the fact that theres 4 of them doesnt help either, as 99/100 post game chats is just survivors insulting the Killer, regardless of what the Killer has done. If the Killer won - he is toxic camper/tunneller etc etc. If the Killer lost - he is trash, noob, loser, l2p, gitgud etc etc. 

 And yeah, inb4 i hear "noob killer main cry cry", i play both roles somewhat equally, and i sit in red ranks with mid-low tier Killers.

But you know, none if these issues are anything new, so i would like to bring up the most important point:

Unlike pretty much ANY other game out there of ANY genre - Dead By Daylight has no casual game mode. It FORCES you into Ranked play, since its the only mode there is. Hence, people take it much more seriously, they tryhard, they bring meta builds and so on.

Also, if you dig back into 2016, one of the key design points of DbD was that survivors are UNABLE to communicate. There were no SWFs allowed in Ranked mode back then, cause thats what DEVS planned, and the game's core mechanics and balance was done AROUND THIS POINT. 
You cant design the game around the formula of (1x1x1x1)x1 and then turn it into a 4x1 and expect it to be balanced, my dudes...

Way to fix this: Introduce Casual game mode, where people could play without feeling pressured by the ranking system, and disallow SWF in ranked, or at least, like in some other games - allow only duos in Ranked, AT LEAST... 4 man SWF is a guaranteed victory, unless the Killer plays Nurse and even then, survivors would have to make plenty of mistakes.

Saw this game and felt it had a very interesting premise. Purchased due to positive reviews but I regretted after. I understand this game is in beta so it's not fair to judge it's lack of functionality. 

But that's how it is, the game at present, is very very limited in scope. You play either as a psychopath with 3 different class to choose from, try to find 4 other survivors in an enclosed environment, and hook them up on meat hooks to die. As a survivors, you work with 3 others to try to escape via toggling some switches in the same environment. These are the only interactions there are in the game.

There is no chat box to talk between killer and survivor. I feel this reduces the amount of entertainment, as chat between killer and even between other survivors would be sure to yield entertaining conversations.

There are no dedicated servers to choose etc. I hope in future the game will be expanded but for now, the game itself feels very empty and hollow. Maybe it's just not my cup of tea.
This game is interesting and unique in how it functions as well as how different players react to it. With luck we can see more from this game, as I think the core concept is really great.

The game mechanics are really good, the idea is wonderful. You really enjoy playing this game both as survivor as like killer. But in this state the game doesnt seem perfectly balanced, at higher ranks the odds are in favour of the survivors (much more if they are premade groups or in voice-com togheter). And sincerely an other point that fear me is the longevity: without proper periodic updates the game will bore. 
Anyway I feel to suggest this game, with the actual price it deserves to be played and will give you many fun moments!

good game to play with friends

Really interesting concept that sounded more fun on paper to me than it ended up being in practice.  Give it a go if you like to try out unique experiences and know what you are getting in to, you may end up liking it a lot and as far as I know there is nothing else quite like this out there right now.  The co op game play can be very satisfying at times.  Grabbing people mid-action and hanging them on meat hooks is also incredibly satisfying if you're in to that sort of thing and let's not kid ourselves, who isn't.

As far as an objective recommendation though, I'm inclined to steer most people who are on the fence away from this game.  Without going in to lots of details and listing where I believe the game could use polish, etc, I'd say at it's worst it is a frustrating exercise in futility and at best it is a game that manages to have some satisfying mechanics but will ultimately not likely be much fun for most people to play on a moment to moment basis.

A horror game where abusing 3rd person camera angle is the core of the gameplay (as survivor)

Features exciting gameplay mechanics such as:
  -holding m1 for long periods of time while listening for audio cues
  -resisting the urge to hold m1
  -holding lctrl for long periods of time while listening for audio cues
  -getting interrupted by evil within bomb-disarming style mini-game at random moments while holding buttons
  -some kind of physical training involving jumping over window sills repeatedly
  -as the killer, feel an overwhelming sense of isolation as the survivors ignore you completely while doing these exercises
  -hammering the spacebar for long periods of time to literally not die
  -user friendly controls: nothing in this game requires precision, only the ability to outsmart idiots and use cheap tactics
  -rare items that change things by 2 and 3%
  -a convoluted ranking system that encourages people to not want to play with each other
  -user friendly configuration options (they are simply left out)
  -character models which you can dress up
  -wooden pallet stomping

OK I digress; the game really isn't bad and it does have a hell of a lot going for it, but it's obviously and unfortunately currently not for me and I urge you to research it before you buy it.
I will be going back to check this game out again in a month or so and see what it has to offer at that time because I really wish I enjoyed playing it more than I do and maybe some changes will remedy that for me.

Entertaining gameplay however, there are some major flaws.

1) you can't play with your friends unless you have a full 5. This sucks because its rough to get 5 people together. It also means poeple are constantly leaving and joining lobbies to try and find their friends. Making the wait even longer.

2) There is no ranking system. So the rank one players just ruin the experience for killers.

3) It's plagued by a series of glitches. The somewhat clunky gameplay plus loading and joining glitches really just makes trying to get into a game an unpleasant experience.

4) This one is more personal preference but I think having a random number generator in the core mechanics really ruins the game. It takes away a huge amount of skill. Sometimes players can get insanely good perk drops that can seriosuly make the game impossibgle for the opposition.

All up its a really fun game but it needs some serious work before its worth $21.
Few days later they fixed the killer issue this is a great game to play with friends 10/10 IGN I recommend

-Rank 20 crawls to victory

-Pick him up, but drop him

-I leave

-Wait 2 mins, come back to area
-Second survivor walked the area, still confused
-First is bleeding out

-First stands, then d/c
-Me and second are left
-I follow second
-Second craps pants as i only follow, not attacking
-Second stares at me
-I travel to a Gen and hit it
-Second starts to get the first Gen up
-I force the survivor to get another Gen up
-Survivor follows me to the Gens
-I lead survivor to trapdoor (forget getting all 5 up lol)
-Survivor escapes

Bought the game not sure what to expect.

Entered my 1st game nervous as hell. Began toying with a generator. Heartbeat begins to thump wildly. I look up to see a hillbilly with a chainsaw bearing down at me at 100 miles an hour. The chainsaw hits the generator in a shower of sparks. I damn near piss myself an scream like a girl and take off running into a cornfied. I find some grass an wait for Cleatus to go away.

Heart starts beating...

Shit does he see me?

THUMP THUMP THUMP THUMP

It's cool. I'm in some grass he will never see me...

THUMPTHUMPTHUMPTHUMP

Chainsaw revs up and Cleatus begins his charge....

He sees me.... OH SHIT HE EFFING SEE MEH!!!!!!

I get waylaid by his chainsaw and then carried away to be implaed on a hook. A teammate comes over to play a goodsport an help me out. Cleatus has other plans. While my teammate trys in vain to kite Cleatus away so he can come back for me, a spider comes down an gobbles me up as I see my teammate go down to Cleatus's hammer.

10/10 would deal with Cleatus and that jackarse spider again.

So I want to start off by saying that this recommendation is very hard to make at the game's current state. The game is a total blast, I had tons of fun playing by myself. HOWEVER the biggest gripe I have with this game like everyone else is that there is no party system whatsoever. Do not go into this game expecting to play with your friends unless you have enough to play on your own private server. The monsters/bad guys/hunters are very creative and look creepy, the game seems pretty damn well balanced, and is a joy to play. I'm recommending this because of how fun it is, and no doubt that there will soon be a party system implemented into the game. Even without friends though, I still find this game addictive for both sides.

キラー側とサバイバー側に分かれて鬼ごっこする1vs4オンライン対戦ゲーム。
コンセプトは面白く、対人ならではの緊張感の中でホラーが楽しめ、小学校・中学校時代によくやったケイドロ（ドロケイ）を思い出させる。
最近のe-Sportsにありがちな煽りや侮辱の流れを受けてか、ゲーム中にチャット機能が備わっていないのが良い。
これによって発生する無言の連携が心地良い。

反対にキラー側も人間を血祭りにするのは楽しいが、現状はキラー側が圧倒的に不利。
また、マッチングが完全にランダムで、熟練者のサバイバーに始めたてのキラーが挑発されたり、スコア稼ぎをされるケースが散見される。
ゲームバランスと、マッチングの改良、バグの多さが解消されればどんどん良いゲームになると思われる。
この時点で「製品版」と名乗るはいささか早すぎる気はするが、勢いの良い売り上げを改良に役立ててほしい。

其实这款游戏为什么会火呢，是因为它本质上还是“捉迷藏”游戏，这个在csgo上已经风靡很久了，现在制作成了独立游戏，又添加了很多新元素，吸引人是肯定的。

首先这款游戏暂时不支持中文，但是可以去3DM下载汉化补丁，以获得良好体验。

1.地图就一张，玩两局就腻了，但是这在后期都是可以加入的。

2.作为一款“捉迷藏”游戏，本作并不小清新，比较血腥，这个就各持己见了，比如我就觉得血腥的游戏很下饭。。。。但是有的人就会不喜欢。。。

3.不管是“幸存者”还是“屠夫”，都是玩家扮演，所以两个阵营可以看作是两款游戏：前者是“慌得要死”，后则是“我好气呀”

4.开黑只能一名选屠夫，一名选幸存者，不能同时选一个阵营= =\\\ 不懂为什么有这样的设定。。。。

5.角色养成的玩法，可以给人物换装，游戏过程中会获取经验点用来解锁天赋技能，这个就大大的增强了游戏的耐玩性

6.游戏不贵，性价比还是蛮高的，推荐购入
